definitions.definition: A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals to nourish their young. From certain animals, especially cows, it is also called dairy milk and is a common food for humans as a beverage or used to produce various dairy products such as butter, cheese, and yogurt.
A white (or whitish) liquid obtained from a vegetable source such as almonds, coconuts, oats, rice, and/or soy beans. Also called non-dairy milk.

definitions.example: Table three ordered three milks. (Formally: The guests at table three ordered three glasses of milk.)

definitions.definition: An individual portion of milk, such as found in a creamer, for tea and coffee.
definitions.example: I take my tea with two milk(s) and two sugar.

definitions.definition: The ripe, undischarged spat of an oyster.
To express milk from (a mammal, especially a cow).
To draw (milk) from the breasts or udder.
definitions.example: to milk wholesome milk from healthy cows

definitions.definition: To express any liquid (from any creature).
To make excessive use of (a particular point in speech or writing, a source of funds, etc.); to exploit; to take advantage of (something).
definitions.example: When the audience began laughing, the comedian milked the joke for more laughs.

definitions.definition: (of an electrical storage battery) To give off small gas bubbles during the final part of the charging operation.
To single-mindedly masturbate a male to ejaculation, especially for the amusement and/or satisfaction of the masturbator/trix rather than the person masturbated.
definitions.example: Controlled milking can actually establish and consolidate a mistressâ€™ dominance over her sub rather than diminish it.
